title: Launching  the  "Vidyawardhana/Arivezhchi/Empower  STEM"  Teacher  Training  Programme  for  Teachers  in  the  Plantation  Sector
decision_details: - The  Government  of  India  has  agreed  to  provide  a  grant  of  Rs.3  billion  for  the  implementation  of  projects  identified  to  improve  the  living  conditions  of  the  plantation  community.  As  one  of  the  projects  under  the  same,  it  has  been  identified  to  provide  the  necessary  facilities  to  encourage  to  pursue  the  subjects  of  Science,  Technology,  Engineering  and  Mathematics  (STEM)  among  the  students  in  the  plantation  community.  Accordingly,  the  joint  proposal  made  by  the  Minister  of  Education  and  the  Minister  of  Water  Supply  and  Estate  Infrastructure  Development  to  implement  the  "Vidyawardhana/Arivezhchi/Empower  STEM"  Teacher  Training  Programme  to  meet  the  severe  dearth  of  qualified  STEM  teachers  in    schools  in  the  plantation  sector,  under  the  said  project,    was  approved  by  the  Cabinet.
